cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not a heatwave right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 16.6mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 5.69mm of total rain in 3.2 hours.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.
A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 10 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (190°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 64.8 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.4°C) and outside temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 0.9 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1484 m), rainfall (down 0.4 mm), and light levels (up 7555 lux) when compared to today.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 565m and a high of 1838m, averaging 1101.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
